newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Kisan says buys Jeewon bonds.
newsitem.headline: Kisan says buys Jeewon bonds.

text.p: South Korea's Kisan Co Ltd said on Thursday it had bought 10 billion won worth of convertible bonds issued and held by Jeewon Industrial Co.
But a statement from Kisan, an affiliate of Kia Motors Corp, denied rumours that the company had agreed to take over the communications equipment maker.
"Rumours of our takeover of Jeewon Industrial Co are untrue," the statement said.
Kisan, a general construction firm, said the bonds purchase was made on November 12.
Each bond, which carries a coupon rate of one percent, can be converted into Jeewon common shares at a price of 23,190 won per share, the statement said.
The request for conversion can be made between November 11, 1995 and November 30, 1998.
Maturity of the bonds is set for December 31, 1998. The statement gave no further details.
On Thursday, Kisan shares closed down 190 won to 9,800, while Jeewon shares fell 1,700 won to 27,300.
